name: NonnyChat
description: Anonymous real-time chat that uses websockets to broadcast messages to browsers using the same 'room'.

name: CoronaVirus: The Card Game
description: A twist on games like Mafia and One Night Ultimate Werewolf, where players try to deceive each other to determine what's what and who's who.

name: GraphQL Practice: A Project Skills Database
description: he project leverages the built-in 'notarealdb' in Node instead of using a real database, and then refers to JSON files for Projects and Skills data. Ajax requests and DOM manipulations are performed using jQuery.

name: 2D JavaScript Game
description: A top-down 2D game demo that lets you pick one of 4 characters and move them around the map. There's not much to id, but it was a proof of concept using websockets, jquery and mongodb to build something that would update for other players in real time.

name: twtVagrant: Tools for Setting up a Quick and Dirty Dev Environment
description: This is a set of tools for running virtual boxes with various programming tools installed, like Apache, PHP, Node, Python, MySQL and Mongo.

name: The Archives of Historical and Ethnographic Yiddish Memories
description: A WordPress website for The Archives of Historical and Ethnographic Yiddish Memories, a project based out of Indiana University Bloomington.

name: JobTortoise: Academic Job Search Website
description: No longer maintained, it still functions for demonstrating a project that used PHP, MySQL, Google Maps and some home-brewed JS/Ajax. Try searching for 'English' to get a few results.

name: Vaccine Appointment Scraper
description: Frustrated with the checkboxes and click-through required to discover that no appointments were available anyway, I wrote a scraper using Node and Puppeteer that would click through, look at the locations of appointments (if any), and then find the driving distance from my location using Google's API. If nearby appointments were available, it would use Twilio to text me a direct link to go snag one.

name: Using Redis with Node
description: This thing is stupidly simplistic, used purely to screw around with Redis and Node. I might turn it into something useful at some point, but for now it just demonstrates setting and getting from Redis through a Node application.

name: FHIR Mobile App Demo
description: A sample app written using JavaScript and compiled with Cordova that demonstrates working with FHIR (Fast Health Interoperability Resources) using Python.

name: Python and FHIR
description: A sample app demonstrating working with FHIR (Fast Health Interoperability Resources) using Python.
